Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 524126: Direct Property and Casualty Insurance Carriers
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Private Litigation Case Title: McLaughlin, et al v. Liberty Mutual Ins.
Ventresco v Liberty Mutual Ins Co
Moyle et al v. Liberty Mutual Retirement Benefit Plan et al

Info Source: Auto Insurer Required to Stop Allegedly Misleading Ads, States News Service, Februay 6, 2007 (via Nexis).

Description: Liberty Mutual Insurance Co. agreed to pay $2 million to settle allegations it paid secret commissions to insurance brokers for preferential access to clients.

Metropolitan Property & Casualty, Liberty Mutual Insurance Company, Peerless Insurance company, Plymouth Rock Assurance Corporation and Pilgrim Insurance Company agreed to jointly pay a total of over $100,000 as part of a settlement of allegations they failed to provide updated at-fault accident determinations to a private data collection company after the state's Board of Appeals overturned the determinations. The announcement did not indicate how much each company would pay. Here we assume the total was divided equally among them.

Safety Insurance Company, Liberty Mutual Insurance Company and Quincy Mutual Fire Insurance Company agreed to pay a total of $11.1 million in restitution, resolving allegations that they overcharged consumers for motorcycle insurance.

Metropolitan Property & Casualty, Liberty Mutual Insurance Company, Peerless Insurance company, Plymouth Rock Assurance Corporation and Pilgrim Insurance Company agreed to jointly pay a total of over $100,000 as part of a settlement of allegations they failed to provide updated at-fault accident determinations to a private data collection company after the state's Board of Appeals overturned the determinations. The announcement did not indicate how much each company would pay. Here we assume the total was divided equally among them.

Liberty Mutual agreed to pay $925,000 to the District Attorneys of Los Angeles, Riverside and San Diego counties in settlement of allegations it advertised an accident forgiveness program that was not available in California, since it was illegal under state law.

Agency: Arizona Department of Insurance and Financial Institutions
Notes: This case was brought by the Arizona Department of Insurance before it merged with the Department of Financial Institutions.

Agency: Arizona Department of Insurance and Financial Institutions
Notes: This case was brought by the Arizona Department of Insurance before it merged with the Department of Financial Institutions.

Description: Safeco Insurance Company  agreed to pay a $900,000 fine and reform its approval process to resolve allegations that it used unapproved credit scores to deny homeowners coverage and that it failed to follow its own approved rating guidelines.
